conclusion: The operating point of the circuit is given by the intersection of curve a and straight line b.
From the graph, the two curves cross at I ≈ 0.25 A, U ≈ 2.5 V.
The open-circuit terminal voltage is the vertical-axis intercept of curve a, which is about U0 ≈ 3.6 V.
The battery’s internal resistance r is obtained from r = (U0 – U) / I.
Substituting the coordinates of the operating point: r = (3.6 V – 2.5 V) ÷ 0.25 A = 1.1 V ÷ 0.25 A ≈ 4.4 Ω.
The internal resistance of the silicon photocell at the given light intensity is approximately 4.4 Ω.
